website_summaries.verdict: A jelly roll pan that's built for durability with a traditional design.
pros: Stands out for its wire rod reinforced rims along with heavy aluminized steel to prevent warping
Comes with a lifetime warranty, making it a worry-free purchase
cons: Safe for dishwasher, but hand-washing is recommended

customer_reviews.title: Raised logo in corner makes this cookie sheet a dud
customer_reviews.text: The the corner of this cookie sheet there is a raised (i.e. bumpy) "Chicago Metallic" logo - meaning that any cookie in that spot woudl be very difficult to remove from the sheet because a spatula would not slide smoothly under the cookie. What a stupid and arrogant move on the part of Chicago Metallic. Clearly the people who made this baking sheet have never made cookies. Returned it and will avoid other products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sheet pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a small thing that has had an unexpected positive impact on my quality of life. No more warping! No more lining with foil! Such evenly browned vegetables! Honestly, if you're roasting with other sheet pans, you're doing it wrong. I love cooking so much, and now I love it even more. 'Bout ready to buy another set in the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Rebtile

customer_reviews.title: Ruined!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about 2 years ago. I wasn't sure what happened to the finish but my husband who does the dishes had this one sit in the sink overnight to get the roasted butternut squash off of it. The finish is horrible now and like other reviewers I hesitate to use if even with a liner. To the trash it goes. Someone commented that they react with other metals because they are aluminized steel and to stick with pure aluminum pans. My advice spend the extra and go for commercial grade 100% aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Veg Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Companies should be responsible for their descriptions
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pan of a certain size to fit my oven. Naturally, I reviewed many descriptions and comments - this was supposed to be a maximum of 15" long by 10" wide, which would fit. FYI - THIS PAN IS 15.5" LONG BY 10.75" WIDE! DOES NOT FIT!
customer_reviews.author: Rhinin

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste money buying cheap cookie and baking sheets like I did for years. Those cheap ones always warp and come off the rack and the food burns or cooks unevenly. These are heavy and sturdy don’t change shapes and easy to clean your food will come out much better especially the all important cookie!! And honestly these really don’t cost that much and you won’t need to replace them i have them in several sizes, love them.
customer_reviews.author: BKZOE

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling large cuts of meat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use when transporting and slicing large cuts of BBQ. It's large size allows me to carry a pork shoulder inside and then use the same pan for shredding. Just fits a whole rack of spare ribs. I'll probably get some quarter size pans to use for smaller cuts like steaks or pork chops.
customer_reviews.author: nobius

customer_reviews.title: Coating comes off with first use
customer_reviews.text: If you like your hands and your sponge turning black every time you touch the pan by all means by this pan
customer_reviews.author: Anissa Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy/heavy and because it's uncoated I know that it's as chem free as I'd like. So far it's not warped or whatever and it perfectly fits this cooking rack that I got to use with it:
customer_reviews.author: Steve Markgraf

customer_reviews.title: Commercial grade alright
customer_reviews.text: This is really well-made, solid (no warping) and heavy. Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Tramdack

customer_reviews.title: High quality you won't find in other baking pans.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan over 4 years ago and now am reordering another as the size is so handy for baking and roasting.. I LOVE that it is heavy duty. It has held up to continued use for all this time. I am not in the habit of leaving pans to clean later, to me it is much more efficient to clean them right after use, so I'm not sure of the problems I read about stacking used pans together. Can't say how many pans I have bought that were so flimsy they warped and didn't cook evenly. I love these pans.
customer_reviews.author: Older & Wiser

customer_reviews.title: Expected more
customer_reviews.text: These sheet feel very nice and heavy and I had high hopes that they would not warp. Not happening though. At 400f in the middle of a gas oven all three I had bought warped. Maybe they work for something with lower heat requirements but even with 375f they did still warp. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NostalgicMom

customer_reviews.title: ALL CHICAGO METALLIC WARES EXCEED MY EXPECTATIONS....
customer_reviews.text: The first Chicago Metallic item I purchased was the three-section lasagna pan. After using it for three types of lasagna to make three people happy with their own individual ingredient lasagnas, I then used it to make three different types of meat loaf. Then, a stew in one section, scalloped potatoes in the middle section, and green beans in the third section. All so successful, I'm buying more Chicago Metallic items in the future. My first "next" purchase was the jelly roll pan. My next purchase will be the brownie pan.
customer_reviews.author: AVMA LIBRARY

customer_reviews.title: Got dented pans twice
customer_reviews.text: First order both pans arrived with lots of dents even though the shipping packaging was fine. We returned them, but the replacement has a big dent on it as well. Moving on to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: Not just for baking.
customer_reviews.text: I have a slightly older Chicago Metallic pan and love it. As I've taken up jigsaw puzzles that pan was very useful and I purchased this one to help me sorting pieces and as a second baking sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Noel C. Borden

customer_reviews.title: Looks like good quality but warps in the oven midway through baking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a couple of months ago since my old cookie sheets would warp/buckle in the oven midway through booking. Sheet always flatten out after it cooled but decided to get thicker heavy duty cookie sheets to prevent the buckling. I recently used them to bake bacon and they buckled midway through too! I am so sad because these pans really felt heavy duty but i am still having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: L H

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: It was about time for me to replace my cookie sheets and these are definitely several steps up. I love them and am definitely using them more often than I used the old ones. I would definitely recommend these pans!
customer_reviews.author: Anna, Huntington Beach CA

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed that "Chicago Metallic" is stamped on the interior of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to add to my collection of old Chicago Metallic 1/2 sheet pans (same style #) that have performed well over many years. However, I am disappointed that "Chicago Metallic" is stamped on the interior of the pan. The picture on Amazon doesn't show this stamp and my old pans are stamped on the exterior of the pans so I was surprised to see it. I'm concerned that food/oil will get cooked on around the stamp and will be hard to clean. However, I will probably keep the new pans because I like the quality of my old pans.
customer_reviews.author: rhshopping

customer_reviews.title: Size description isn’t accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice and sturdy, feels good quality. But the size is inaccurate. It says on the product description 15in by 10 inches and when it showed up the label says 14.75 by 9.75. So not a huge difference but when baking things like that can really make a difference so keep it in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: These were recommended on a TV program so I found them on ...
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended on a TV program so I found them on Amazon. They are very solid, much heavier than regular cookie sheets. I've used them with parchment paper and without for baking. Either way works great. These are deep enough to use racks (I use cookie cooling racks) to let grease drip down away from the food. Very solid, won't bend or lift like lightweight cookie sheets can do. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: CLS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the jelly roll size. It works perfectly for cookies, other things! Using it with silicone baking mats is a great combination. Love it! Wish I had bought them years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: DeeO

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received the 2 pack tray today. While the first tray in the front was okay the second tray on the bottom was dented. If I don’t have a need for it today then I would’ve returned it already. So sad!!!
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Great pans
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased these twice now because I like them so much. They hold up well to roasting veggies multiple times a week. I like that they are uncoated as I worry about nonstick coating and high heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kristinaki

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a pan to replace one of my grandmother's old pans. (You can imagine how that thing looked.) It needed to be small enough to fit in my side-by-side freezer as I use it to freeze berries, cookie dough, etc. before bagging them up. I tried another brand and ended up returning it because it was so flimsy. This pan is very solid, has a nice feel to it, and fits well in my freezer. Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: Collette L. Rand

customer_reviews.title: BEST BEST BEST I've found.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this. I thought it might be too small but its perfect for my needs. Very heavy duty but not painfully heavy. Wish I'd bought it years ago instead of dealing with my old cheapo bucklers. EDIT: have used this a LOT! Love it. My outrageously expensive heavy...heavy stainless steel, while almost flawless, doesn't bake up cookies anywhere near as beautifuly. Love the depth of the sides. It is an rxcellent product. I use parchment or silicone to line.
customer_reviews.author: DianaruTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Warped with first use
customer_reviews.text: First time I used them they warped :( Would not recommend these at all. Only used in typical baking style to warm pizza - nothing extreme.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Morong

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, durable, heavy weight pans.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, durable pans. However, one of the set is creased. The pan will be fine as its basically just a cosmetic issue. Heavy weight aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: TJammer71

customer_reviews.title: A must have in any kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased these before and they continue to be a great pan and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: LGR

customer_reviews.title: sheet pan
customer_reviews.text: I've had them a short time, but love the size and durability. I have not used them on top the stove, as they say they can be, and most likely won't. I had bought them for baking and will probably confine usage to that. Definitely an upgrade than what I was able to purchase in the store.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dunkin

customer_reviews.title: All the cookies
customer_reviews.text: There really isn’t anything too special about these sheets that I’ve seen so far. They do great in the oven. No warping (which is important to me). They are a bit heavy and don’t slide across the oven racks very easily. Food cooks thoroughly and there is a lot more space for more cookies. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Grace

customer_reviews.title: Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. Very heavy. I was disappointed at first but then I used it. Bakes very evenly. No dark bottoms on cookies. Excellent for cookies.
customer_reviews.author: peggy c. martin

customer_reviews.title: Don't bake cookies without it
customer_reviews.text: I used to think my wife was a mediocre cookie maker. Cookies came out uneven, some burned, some under cooked. As it turned out, it was the pan. I read some advice that these high grade uncoated aluminum sheets were the best (I usually opt for non-stick). Cookies are now evenly cooked, the pan does not warp in the oven, and it is easy to clean. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Expert999

customer_reviews.title: No Adhesive Problem
customer_reviews.text: Based on the previous reviews, I was prepared to battle with adhesive from the label. But there was no problem at all. There was only a small dot of adhesive that pulled right off the pan when i lifted the label. Maybe the company got the message loud and clear and corrected glue problem. The pans are exactly what I expected (I already owned one and wanted to have two more). These are the best cookie sheets for my annual Christmas cookie baking. Heavyduty, thick and evenly distributes the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: The perfect pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is fantastic; it is the perfect thickness, leaving no concern for it warping and it has no non-stick surface to worry about scraping or chipping off. You can scrub this thing all day long and not damage it in any way, or run it through the dishwasher and know that it will be fine. This is what I consider to be the perfect baking pan. I love this pan and will definitely buy more as they are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to clean, tried with and without wax paper, and with oil spray. Shiny and beautiful, a joy to use. I bought two of these for this year's Christmas cookies, and used them about a dozen times. No warps. A little bit harder to grab when taking out from the oven. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: KK69

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love these pans! Very high quality and very sturdy. I was very happy that they fit in my convection oven/microwave combo. Of course I can't use them on the microwave setting (LOL), but they did a beautiful job baking cookies on the convection setting. I haven't used them on a higher setting than 375F but I don't forsee them warping because of how well they're made. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: It is nice and heavy and I can see why people love ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pan for a specific recipe. It is nice and heavy and I can see why people love these pans. However, there was a slight dent in the pan where the bottom meets the side. This pan is so heavy, not sure what could've made this dent because the box was unscathed. Is it enough for me to send it back? No and the pan will work just fine. I am a little disappointed though.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great christmas gift to my mom...
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my mother and she loves them.
customer_reviews.author: RPRD

customer_reviews.title: Quality product baking
customer_reviews.text: How many products made by Chicago metallic and all our of Excellence quality. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: bsjhaley

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love with a sheet pan
customer_reviews.text: My former housemate had these and I loved them so much I had to buy
customer_reviews.author: Lori Wear

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Pan
customer_reviews.text: This heavy jelly roll pan produces the perfect jelly roll cake! The yule log (cake) we made from this pan turned out evenly baked and was a snap to clean up. I also use this jelly roll pan weekly to make the perfect pizza, as well as it is now my go to cookie pan. I have since purchased an additional pan. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Book Mama

customer_reviews.title: Quality baking Sheet pans
customer_reviews.text: I really like these baking sheet pans. I line them with sil-mats too. Great combo together.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: but perfect for all of the uses I put them to
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. They are smaller than a traditional jelly roll pan, but perfect for all of the uses I put them to. from cookies, to melted cheese sandwiches...I've never burned a sandwich since I started using them...good heat distribution. I'm very happy with these pans
customer_reviews.author: Hope Walters

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled to bits
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this product based on some of the reviews.I'm glad I ignored them. I have never bought & used such a wonderful cookie sheet.Great size,top finish and NO warping.Super easy to clean too.Perhaps my only suggestion is to reduce your baking time by 5 mins,as this cookie sheet really conducts the heat well.
customer_reviews.author: ODETTE OXFORD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Does what it is supposed to do.I also like that it is not coated with any sort of non-stick product. It is on the heavy side as compared to other similar brands but I enjoy using it. I use chlorine free parchment paper and they work well together. I would have no hesitation in purchasing another from this company.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. W.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, high quality, good size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because I was tired of pans that flex when hot. Only bought one to try first. Very happy, and plan to replace all my crummy pans soon!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Joy

customer_reviews.title: Liked it
customer_reviews.text: This is the best constructed jelly roll pan that is available to the general public.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Best cookie sheets on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these cookie sheets for years. My originals are in great shape but I ordered a couple more for our vacation home. They arrived with a few dents but I don't think this will affect the function of the pans.
customer_reviews.author: LeilaTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality pans - don't get anything else!
customer_reviews.text: These trays are the best. Solid, don't bend in the oven and very reliable. Similar (slightly lighter) than professional versions I have used in commercial kitchens.
customer_reviews.author: NuiG

customer_reviews.title: Always Dependable and Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I love new sheet pans! but they won't be new for long! this is a great product and I highly recommend them as a seller. I have ordered from them many times and always satisfied. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Ger'

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cookies every time
customer_reviews.text: Perfect so far. I always burn the bottoms of cookies on dark nonstick sheets but they are now cooked to perfection on this Chicago cookie sheet and clean up is so quick and easy. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: clairebeej

customer_reviews.title: Great Pans
customer_reviews.text: We already own 4 of these pans, which we have owned for over 7 years, but during the Christmas Season there was the need for an additional 2 pans. Finally bought them and they helped with the Christmas baking. These pans are very heavy made and clean up easily but they need to be washed by hand. Many people these days rely solely on their dishwasher and have no idea how to wash anything by hand. Pans, especially if you grease them, have to be hand washed/scrubbed to remove the baked on grease. These are wonderful pans and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: BlackRam

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best baking sheets I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best baking sheets I've ever owned, right up there with the old, battered ones from the in-laws that I bought these to replace once those became too warped to use. Very sturdy, not too heavy, and have held up well to a lot of baking so far.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Before I used this pan today, I sprayed cooking spray on it. The cooked bread dough popped off beautifully and even though melted cheese had gotten onto the edge where I hadn't sprayed...it even came off easily. Plus I do not have to worry about any coating flecks cookiing into my foods.
customer_reviews.author: A. H. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: They are great pans, but they still warp in the oven ...
customer_reviews.text: They are great pans, but they still warp in the oven and return to shape after they cool. That hasn't caused any problems, but it's just a little disconcerting since I bought these pans because they are fairly heavy and I did not think they would warp.
customer_reviews.author: beachhawk

customer_reviews.title: This isn't a dream pan, it merely does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and the fact that it's a 2 pack. One came a bit scratched up. Both pans warp at temps above 400, and I've found that food scents seem to stay with it. I'm not impressed with this product. So, back to searching for a good baking sheet.
customer_reviews.author: mandirose1

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty cookie sheet. Works well. I have no complaints about it. I use it with a silicone pad & just wipe both clean after each use. Super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: quality product that allows even cooking and easy cleaning. Purchased a second set for use in ...
customer_reviews.text: second time I have purchased these, quality product that allows even cooking and easy cleaning. Purchased a second set for use in a cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, clean up easy and does not warp ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, clean up easy and does not warp under high heat. The metal is thin but overall it is very heavy and strong from the bead and metal ring around the edge. The drawback is the open bead is hard to clean if stuff manages to get in there. This is a great size pan that fits in a residential oven.
customer_reviews.author: Mitt

customer_reviews.title: Just what the baker ordered
customer_reviews.text: These pans are sturdy and do not warp at high temperatures. I use them solely for baking and use parchment, and so far my goodies have come out evenly baked and not burned on the bottom. They have not discolored or "flaked" as some reviewers mentioned. What's not to like!
customer_reviews.author: crackergirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent. I bought two more after the first two.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great sheet pan for bacon
customer_reviews.text: So far a good sturdy pan. No warping at 375 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Sean George

customer_reviews.title: pans
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these pans! Heavy duty and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: C. David

customer_reviews.title: Love these pans!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these pans for years. My originals are in great shape. I came back for a couple more for our vacation home. They arrived with several dents, but it should not affect the function of the pan.
customer_reviews.author: LeilaTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is the BEST. I've used it for fudge nut bars and the size and baking qualities, not to mention reasonable clean up, are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Alice Carey

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to find good quality non-coated baking sheets
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find good quality non-coated baking sheets. I wanted a plain metal baking sheet without rims. These look like they will do a great job. :)
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth E. Hafer

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST OF THE WORST
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The worst of the worst. Difficult to clean. Discolors. Rusts. Not sure if they'll even be any good in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made sturdy pan that works equally well for roasting vegetables or baking cookies evenly. Cleans easily and works well at high heat. The pan does pop a bit as it cools down from a high heat (425 or so) but so far has not warped at all after regular use.
customer_reviews.author: n123

customer_reviews.title: Good uncoated heavy pan.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy. I have an old recipe for a sheet cake and my new coated pans did not do a good job. Happy with this uncoated pan.
customer_reviews.author: DORIS LYNN WESTERMAN

customer_reviews.title: worst pan ever
customer_reviews.text: Pans dont heat up. Nothing will cook not even cookies like on packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not uncoated
customer_reviews.text: I purposely purchased these pans since the description says "uncoated." We had a different brand that lost its coating after a few years and did not want to have to deal with that again. Less than a year of light use (a few times a month) with these pans, a coating is coming off. I'm not sure how an "uncoated" pan can have a coating. I wish I still had the packaging to see if the wrong ones were shipped to us.
customer_reviews.author: J Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Purchased with the matching non-stick cooling rack
customer_reviews.text: I use these sheets constantly. They are perfect for baking cookies. I can use them with a rack for oven-fried green tomatoes. They work well to cool foods - even fried foods. Sturdy and heavy. They endure heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a friend. Is exactly what I wanted, she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: samIam

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy pan. I was pleased to be able to find a commercial grade jelly roll pan for my daughter for Christmas. She needed it to hold a roasting rack ithat would keep chicken warm and the rack was good sized. I have had one of these for years. A good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Connie G

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't warp in heat but doesn't last either. One use and stained permanently. After a few uses coating cones off in spots.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Chicago Metallic Commercial Baking Sheet
customer_reviews.text: This is my third of these baking sheets and I just love them. They hold up well and bake very evenly. I've never been disappointed by anything I've bought from Chicago Metallic.
customer_reviews.author: P. Woodland

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-purpose Pan
customer_reviews.text: I use these for baking anything from cookies to sweet potatoes, to layer cakes and have had great results for all. I also use them for prepping meat for the grill and as a landing pad once the food comes off (yes, I use a clean one for the latter).
customer_reviews.author: Fat Baby King

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pan
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me and is perfect! I will buy more pans like this!!
customer_reviews.author: ReELPteacher

customer_reviews.title: Good cake pan
customer_reviews.text: Made a brownie style cake in this. This is nice and sturdy and cleaned up very well. Heating was even throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Burned the pan the first time we roasted tomatoes at ...
customer_reviews.text: Burned the pan the first time we roasted tomatoes at 425 for 40 minutes WITH PARCHMENT while checking constantly. The tomatoes did not reflect alot of burn, but they scorched the pan beyond repair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: baking sheets
customer_reviews.text: These are nice heavy baking sheets My only concern is that they may scratch I like my baking sheets super clean so they may scratch while cleaning I used them at 425 degree oven and they cooked evenly and didn't warp
customer_reviews.author: Sally Riley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Chicago Metallic Commercial Jelly Roll pans are the best!! High quality that will last forever!!! They clean easily and the 3 sizes we chose fit perfect into our rather small dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Marek

customer_reviews.title: good pan, good price
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, haven't warped in high heat (475 degrees F) clean nicely. Used for roasting veg and making sponge cake for roulades, perform to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Schalk

customer_reviews.title: Quality baking sheets!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice baking sheets. Thick, high quality. I always use parchment paper when using these, so it doesn't matter that they are uncoated. Perfect cookies every time!
customer_reviews.author: Nixon72

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy small pan
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy small pan, exterior about 15 X 10 inches, that allows me to put two side by side on the same shelf while I roast vegetables that require different duration
customer_reviews.author: mjrg

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: These are old style commercial pans and they've already seen heavy use. The holidays will be made that much brighter by these! Don't go cheap on baking pans!
customer_reviews.author: B. Mudry

customer_reviews.title: Great pans
customer_reviews.text: I use these pans for all kinds of things. They are nice and heavy, not cheap and flimsy. great for roasting veggies, etc.
customer_reviews.author: LauraM

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for heavy duty jelly roll pans that would not warp and were not non-stick coated. These can take high heat without warping and my baked goods cook evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Jey

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan makes you feel like you're a professional. Very sturdy & oversized, which makes the baking of several batches of cookies go fast.
customer_reviews.author: N. Meehan

customer_reviews.title: Will Last Many Years
customer_reviews.text: Nice Heavy Duty Pans, perfect size for use on the bottom of the oven and add water to steam bread while baking.
customer_reviews.author: kommay

customer_reviews.title: Love these pans!I
customer_reviews.text: Really love Chicago Metallic uncoated pans--Have them in many sizes. They don't stick. Easy to clean. Finish does not scrape off as in coated pans. My daughters love them too.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Putting away all my non-stick baking sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I like this baking sheet so much better than the ones with non-stick coating. So easy to clean! I've used it at 500 degrees (F) and it doesn't warp.
customer_reviews.author: CookinginOH

customer_reviews.title: Restaurant Quality Pans
customer_reviews.text: Restaurant quality pans. We subject our pans to heavy duty use at least several times a week cooking for the family. We added to our number of pans with these two, and they are even thicker gauge than the ones we have. They don't warp, and they heat very evenly. We are so pleased we ordered two more.
customer_reviews.author: TBB

customer_reviews.title: Good pan
customer_reviews.text: I love these pans. Good for all kinds of things, and they take a beating. I got the big one and the smaller one and I use them often.
customer_reviews.author: LauraM

customer_reviews.title: SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Very solid product built to last. No flex or twist in this product. I've replaced several Teflon sheet over the years. I'm pretty sure these will be the last I'll need to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: By far the best sheet pan we've ever owned. We have several...
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy pan I can use for roasts or heavier items. Well worth the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Cookie Sheet
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy duty and just the right size for my toaster oven. Cleans up nice. Other brands said they were a certain size and they were to big.
customer_reviews.author: judy phillips

customer_reviews.title: I love these pans
customer_reviews.text: I love these pans. They're incredibly sturdy and perfect for all sorts of baking. They're a bit heavy, but that doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: These baking sheets are of high quality and will probably last a long time, but please ensure that you clean any stains or grease immediately after using them because they are somewhat difficult to clean. I even tried using oven cleaner and still had a hard time. Otherwise, i like them because they are much better than those flimsy cooking sheets at Wal-mart.
customer_reviews.author: Rasheda Mayner

customer_reviews.title: cookie sheets
customer_reviews.text: These cookie sheets are above our expectations. They are very good quality. We will definitely buy the Chicago brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Widman

product_meta.title: Chicago Metallic Commercial II Traditional Uncoated Large Jelly Roll Pan, 16-3/4 by 12-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:16-3/4 by 12Chicago Metallic has built an unmatched reputation as the "Bakeware Experts" by delivering commercial quality, high performance products employing premium materials and construction. Chicago Metallic is proud to introduce Commercial II, a top of the line assortment of bakeware. Offering both traditional uncoated and dual coated, diamond-quality non-stick Bakeware, the Commercial II line provides the strength and durability to craft delectable results day after day. The entire line is made of heavy-weight aluminized steel for superior heat conduction and even baking results. The Lifetime warranty ensures the avid baker sturdy construction and product longevity. This collection is dishwasher safe, however hand-washing is recommended to extend the product life. This Chicago Metallic Commercial II traditional uncoated jelly roll pan is strong and durable with long-lasting construction. A wire rod reinforcement prevents warping. It measures 16-3/4 by 12 by 1-Inch.
feature_bullets: Made from heavy-weight aluminized steel for superior heat conduction and even baking; features wire rod reinforced rims to prevent warping
Features a traditional, uncoated baking surface
Dishwasher safe, however hand-washing is recommended to extend product life
Ideal for like one-sheet dinners, jelly rolls, bars, and cookies but can also be used to make one-sheet pan meals, roast vegetables, reheat leftovers
